frameDefinitions: An Agent has the means to affect a Theme along the lines of a certain Domain.
A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit)
Lexical units in this frame refer to Electricity, in particular as a form of energy harnessed for particular uses (such as powering machines).
These are words referring to control by a Leader over a particular entity  or group (the Governed) or an Activity.
An Entity meets the pre-conditions for participating in an Event.
An Exerter, Action, or Force is capable of exerting or does exert a physical force at a level specified by the target.
frameExamples: His <t>authority</t> over his subjects was given to him by God.
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.
A compound to generate wind <t>electricity</t> was built on the other side of those mountains.
Sebek em hat was a <t>Leader</t> of Priests. ca. 1780 BC
Conductor software gives us the hands-on <t>capability</t> to provide updates immediately
Eugenie loved the sea and was a <t>strong</t> swimmer.
listRoleDefinitions: The person or organization with more influence or power.
The person or organization with less influence or power.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
<fen>Electricity</fen> is the physical force that is used as power.

The <fen>Leader</fen> is the one who has the role of leading.  With verbs, and with predicate nominals linking an individual to a <fen>Role</fen>, the <fen>Leader</fen> is usually the External Argument:

The role played by the <fen>Leader</fen> in a given situation, often an official title; incorporated in most noun LUsin this frame. When expressed separately from the target, <fen>Role</fen> usually occurs in a PP Complement headed by <ment>as</ment>.
The entity whose actions or beliefs the <fen>Leader</fen> directs in the context of a joint activity or movement.  This entity can be a political body, a person, or a group of people.
The <fen>Leader</fen> directs the <fen>Activity</fen>.
<fen>Time</fen> refers to the point in time that the leadership took place.
The locale from which the <fen>Leader</fen> leads the <fen>Governed</fen> or the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The <fen>Entity</fen> whose meeting or falling short of pre-conditions is assessed.
The <fen>Event</fen> that the <fen>Entity</fen> may participate in.
The time at which the <fen>Entity</fen> is capable of the <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Exerter</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Force</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Action</fen> that can or does exert a force of the level specified by the target.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
The location where the <fen>Exerter</fen>, <fen>Action</fen>, or <fen>Force</fen> can or does exert its force.
listRoleExamples: It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.
The Brunswick Electric Membership Corporation supplies <fex><t>electricity</t></fex> for sections of Brunswick and Columbus counties.
The general led his troops into battle <fex>on June 22, 1883</fex>.
He ruled the west <fex>from his palace in Milan</fex>.
White House voices doubts about Aristide's ability <fex>to govern</fex>
Salesmen touted the power <fex>of the engine's motor</fex>.
No one should underestimate the mighty <fex>strength</fex> of the dung beetle.
She gave him a playful, weak <fex>punch</fex> in the arm.
My quads feel particularly weak <fex>after 100 squats</fex>.
Muhammad Ali's force <fex>in the ring</fex> was indisputable.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
